TEXT: I. Circumstances of the case
CARDINAL . The applicants , CARDINAL sisters and a brother , own a farmhouse and adjoining land , which they use for agricultural purposes .

CARDINAL . On DATE , as part of the implementation of the general development plan adopted pursuant to Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , GPE ( " the Municipality " ) issued an order , under an expedited procedure , for the possession of the applicants ' land , which was located in a zone intended for the construction of low - cost and social housing ( " edilizia economica e popolare " ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE took physical possession of the land , aided by the police . On DATE ORG issued an expropriation order .

CARDINAL . From the outset the applicants challenged the lawfulness of the measures taken by the authorities ; they brought several actions in the administrative courts and in the ordinary civil courts .
A. Action for possession in the ordinary civil courts

CARDINAL . On DATE they applied to ORG ( pretore ) seeking the restitution of their land on the ground that the order for possession under the expedited procedure of CARDINAL DATE had been executed after the expiry of the statutory time - limit ( DATE ) .
By an interim decision of DATE , the ORG found for the applicants . GPE did not comply with the decision .

On DATE the ORG reversed its earlier interim decision because in the meantime the expropriation order of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) had legalised the occupation of the land . It ruled nevertheless that the taking of possession of the land on DATE had been unlawful and amounted to an act of theft . It ordered the Municipality to pay compensation for the damage sustained by the applicants on this account .

CARDINAL . GPE contested its liability to pay compensation and , on DATE , appealed to ORG , which , on DATE , upheld the impugned decision . The text of the judgment was deposited in the registry on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , the CARDINAL cooperatives responsible for carrying out the building work ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) had brought an action against the applicants seeking compensation for the damage deriving from the delay to the property development scheme caused by the proceedings brought by the applicants .
B. Proceedings on the merits in the administrative courts
CARDINAL . By a writ served on DATE , the applicants instituted proceedings in ORG ( " the ORG " ) seeking judicial review of the expedited order for possession of CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE they filed a new action contesting the occupation of the land and on DATE , in the same court , they challenged the expropriation order of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . Following the joinder of these different proceedings , the ORG quashed , on DATE , the various administrative measures - including the expropriation order - , but found that it lacked jurisdiction to rule on the lawfulness of the taking of possession of the applicants ' land on DATE ; it took the view that this question was a matter for the ordinary courts . The text of its decision was deposited in the registry on DATE .
CARDINAL . The LOC appealed to the PERSON , which , in a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , deposited in the registry on CARDINAL DATE , upheld the ORG 's decision .
C. Enforcement proceedings
CARDINAL . In the administrative courts
CARDINAL . As the Municipality failed to comply with the latter decision , the applicants instituted proceedings in the Consiglio di Stato .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Consiglio di Stato found that it lacked jurisdiction and remitted the case to ORG .

On DATE the applicants applied to the ORG , which , on DATE , found partly in their favour , holding in substance that the annulment by the PERSON of the contested expropriation measures had the effect of imposing a duty on the GPE to return immediately the part of the land that it had occupied on which no buildings had been erected , namely QUANTITY . It accordingly ordered that the land in question be returned

to the applicants within DATE . In respect of the remaining parcels of land , on which residential accommodation had been built in the meantime , the ORG held that it had no jurisdiction to order enforcement , because even before the annulment of the expropriation , the GPE had transferred the land in question to CARDINAL building ORG . As a result physical possession of the property had passed to the members of the CARDINAL cooperatives . As the latter were private citizens , neither the GPE nor the ORG was empowered to make any order whatsoever in regard to enforcement . It referred the applicants to the ordinary courts .
This decision was deposited in the registry on DATE ; it was not complied with .
CARDINAL . In the ordinary courts
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants served notice on the Municipality calling on it to comply with the decision of ORG of DATE , upheld by the PERSON on DATE .

CARDINAL . By a writ served on CARDINAL DATE , the GPE brought proceedings against the applicants in the GPE ORG seeking a declaration that the applicants ' notice to comply was invalid or inoperative because the judgment in question did not constitute a proper basis for initiating enforcement proceedings .

The applicants filed a cross - action seeking , in addition to the restitution of their land , an order from ORG for the demolition of the buildings constructed on part of it and the erection of a fence . They also claimed compensation for the damage sustained .

CARDINAL . At the hearing on CARDINAL DATE judgment was reserved . On CARDINAL DATE ORG declared the notice served on the Municipality invalid on the ground that although the ORG judgment had quashed the measures adopted in connection with the expropriation , it was not automatically enforceable . At the same time the court partly allowed the applicants ' cross - action in so far as it related to compensation for damage and the restitution of the land .
CARDINAL . By a writ served on CARDINAL DATE , the GPE appealed .

On DATE judgment was reserved . On DATE ORG partly set aside the impugned decision pursuant to LAW no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ( " the DATE Law " - the socalled " PERSON " ) . This law , which came into force on DATE , gave legislative force to a principle laid down by ORG ( in plenary session ) in its judgment no . CARDINAL of DATE , namely that property on which public work had been carried out making it impossible to restore it to its owner was to be the subject of compulsory transfer to the public authorities . In such circumstances the person concerned was entitled to full compensation .

Thus the appeal court dismissed the applicants ' claim for the restitution of the land . However , it confirmed their right to compensation for the damage sustained . The text of its judgment was deposited in the registry on DATE .

CARDINAL . At a date that has not been specified , the applicants appealed on points of law , challenging , among other things , the retrospective application of the DATE Law . On DATE ORG adjourned the hearing to a later date .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , deposited in the registry on DATE , ORG dismissed the appeal on the ground that the appeal court had correctly applied the DATE Law in the case before it because the applicants had not yet obtained a final decision ordering GPE to return the land which had been built on .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants issued a writ against the ORG and GPE in FAC for a decision fixing the amount to be reimbursed to them .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants served a notice to comply on the Municipality , which , on the following DATE paid them MONEY .

II . Relevant domestic law
A. Legislative provisions
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL , paragraph CARDINAL , of PERSON no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE provides :

" The occupation of land under the expedited procedure with a view to its expropriation shall be authorised by the ORG . Such an order shall lapse if possession of the land is not taken within DATE on which it was issued . "
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE states :

" Any person who owns land which is used for the construction of public buildings or social housing shall be entitled to compensation for damage sustained where the expropriation has been declared unlawful by a court decision which has become final , but such person may not claim restitution of his property .

Further , such a person is entitled , in addition to compensation for damage , to sums payable in respect of monetary depreciation and to any other sums mentioned in Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW , such amounts being calculated from the date of the unlawful taking of possession . "
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Civil Code provides :

" Any creditor who establishes that he has suffered greater loss is entitled to be compensated therefor . There is no such entitlement in cases where it has been agreed that interest would be paid in case of delay . "
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure is worded as follows :
" The attachment of a debtor 's funds held by third parties ... shall be effected by a writ served in person on the third party and the debtor ... "

CARDINAL . Interpreting section CARDINAL of the DATE Law , ORG held in its judgment ( no . CARDINAL ) of CARDINAL DATE :

" In the impugned provision , the legislature has given preference , as between the owner 's interest in obtaining restitution of his unlawfully - expropriated land , and the public interest - in this case the allocation of such land for building public , low cost or subsidised housing - to this latter interest .
